text: Can we give permission for CRM Cards to only specific HubSpot roles/users ?

Hi

What is the easiest way to migrate HubSpot Blogs to WordPress?
Thank you in advance

Hi there,
Honestly speaking the easiest way is to copy and paste each post one by one but its only feasible for a count i guess less than 5 to 10.
The other smart way of doing the same is:
• Open to Your Design Manager.
•  Create a New Blog Template.
•  Copy and Paste the Following Code.
•  Preview the Page.
•  Save the Template as a .CSV.
•  Install WP All Import.
•  Head to Your WordPress and Upload Your CSV File.
•  Drag and Drop Your Data.
•  Check the "Categories" Checkbox and Drag and Drop Your Post Category Coding.
•  Drag and Drop the Rest of Your Data.
•  Confirm and Run Import.
Code to paste -
```{% set export = blog_recent_posts('YOUR_BLOG_ID_HERE', 200) %} "post_title","post_slug","post_date","post_content","post_thumbnail","post_author","post_category",<br>
{% for content in export %} "{{ content.name|forceescape }}","{{ content.slug|forceescape|replace('blog/', '') }}","{{ content.publish_date_localized|forceescape }}","{{ content.post_body|replace('"','""')|forceescape|escape_jinjava }}","{{ content.featured_image }}","{{ content.blog_post_author }}","{{ content.topic_list|forceescape|replace('[', '')|replace(']', '') }}"<br>{% endfor %}```

As a purely hypothetical question, if there was a situation where client refused to pay bills because no work was done, and has wiped their HubSpot account clean, and the site was never live ie. not in <http://web.archive.org|web.archive.org> or such, would there be a way to verify the site actually existed on HubSpot end if hypothetically you had to take the legal route on this issue. In theory. At least the portal is downgraded to non-CMS tier, fantastically

<#C22PU4LV8|general> Hi,

*How to Create Contact Deal and Line items using Ecommerce Bridge API*
I need a suggestion on using the Ecommerce Bridge. We have a worker(windows) service, which is receiving the order information and then making an API call for creating Contact, Deal, and Line items. Can I use Ecommerce Bridge API to do creating/updating Contact, Deal, and Line items in one API call?

I’m finding that the oAuth system has become quite unstable and we have had to edit it multiple time in the past month.  I dont know if its something we did or something HubSpot did.  Anyone else getting similar issues where scopes that were accepted no longer have sufficient permission? <https://hello.digital22.com/watch/ndvnAFNK49ex48uJFFEY6o>?

Hi everyone - correct me, please. On the blog, I can only upload one featured image in one size, which can be linked to the blog post as publicly available attribute that I can via custom module in the regular page. HubSpot will not resize the uploaded images and provide smaller versions of it, so if I need some big hero images to be used as a background for a hero section on the blog page, I have to upload it in high resolution, meaning that when I render the list of blog posts on the index page (for example), there are no smaller thumbnail I could use and I have to render full-size images, meaning significantly increase loading time of the site, right?

You as the developer control the size of the image rendered onto the page using resize_image_url() 

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#resize-image-url|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#resize-image-url>

I hear ya, speed is important, there's a lot you as a developer can do to influence the speed of your site, and most of it isn't HubSpot specific. One recommendation is to start with optimizing images and optimizing your JavaScript.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/speed>

Additionally if you need custom tailored performance optimization help, our partners would love to help:
<https://www.HubSpotmatch.com/create_rfp?service_id=173928972>
You could implement this logic within your CRM card handler and return different responses based on roles, but this isn’t something that HubSpot supports.

Scoping out a project for a client… On the blog archive page client wants to showcase multiple images from blog posts in a carousel. Is it possible to add “custom fields” to a blog post that could be used on the blog archive page. Here’s an example of the design:

Yup, you could definitely do that. Any modules/tags you add to the post template as export_to_template_context are available to display (or not) at either the post or listing level. I'd create a custom module featuring a repeater of image fields.
Thanks for the input. As far as UX goes for content editor do you think it’s pretty easy to use?
Yeah, they would just get an additional field in the content sidebar on the left. It won't be as WYSIWYG as the body of the post, but we've used this strategy on on a number of sites
Are there any plans to introduce alias/shortcuts to common places? for example: `$modules/my-module`  instead of `../../../../modules/my-module`
(on a related note, the path to modules within "reusable sections" confused me for minutes...)
